section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > e. Fetal Conditions Affecting the Management of the Mother > 2) In utero surgery

content.full_text: In cases when surgery is performed on the fetus, a diagnosis code from category O35, Maternal care for known or suspected fetal abnormality and damage, should be assigned identifying the fetal condition. Assign the appropriate procedure code for the procedure performed. No code from Chapter 16, the perinatal codes, should be used on the mother's record to identify fetal conditions. Surgery performed in utero on a fetus is still to be coded as an obstetric encounter. (Evidence: pg no: 66, L84-L87)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding in utero fetal surgery on maternal records (Evidence: pg no: 66, L84-L87)
key_concepts: O35 category for fetal surgery (Evidence: pg no: 66, L85-L86)
Procedure code assignment (Evidence: pg no: 66, L86)
Chapter 16 code exclusion (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)
Obstetric encounter classification (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use O35 category for fetal condition when in utero surgery performed (Evidence: pg no: 66, L85-L86)
detailed_rules.explanation: When fetal surgery is performed, assign diagnosis code from O35 category to identify the fetal condition being treated (Evidence: pg no: 66, L85-L86)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign appropriate procedure code for surgery performed (Evidence: pg no: 66, L86)
detailed_rules.explanation: In addition to diagnosis code, assign the specific procedure code for the fetal surgery performed (Evidence: pg no: 66, L86)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not use Chapter 16 perinatal codes on mother's record (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)
detailed_rules.explanation: Perinatal codes from Chapter 16 should not be used on the maternal record for fetal conditions (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)

detailed_rules.rule_text: In utero surgery coded as obstetric encounter (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)
detailed_rules.explanation: Surgery performed on fetus in utero is still considered an obstetric encounter for coding purposes (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify fetal surgery performed in utero
Step 2: Assign O35 code for fetal condition being treated
Step 3: Assign appropriate procedure code for surgery
Step 4: Do not use Chapter 16 codes on maternal record

code_ranges.description: Maternal care for known or suspected fetal abnormality and damage (Evidence: pg no: 66, L85-L86)
code_ranges.requirement: Use for fetal conditions requiring in utero surgery
usage_rules: Identify specific fetal condition being treated (Evidence: pg no: 66, L85-L86)

code_ranges.requirement: Do not use on maternal record
usage_rules: Excluded from maternal records for fetal conditions (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)

references_to.title: Codes from categories O35 and O36
references_to.explanation: Specific application of O35 codes for surgical intervention

coding_scenarios.scenario: In utero repair of fetal spina bifida at 26 weeks gestation
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient underwent in utero fetal surgery for repair of spina bifida at 26 weeks gestation, procedure successful
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify in utero surgery for spina bifida
Step 2: Assign O35.03X0 for maternal care for fetal spina bifida
Step 3: Assign appropriate procedure code for fetal spina bifida repair
Step 4: Do not use any P codes on maternal record

correct_coding.rationale: In utero surgery requires O35 code for fetal condition, not perinatal codes (Evidence: pg no: 66, L85-L87)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use Chapter 16 perinatal codes on maternal record
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using perinatal codes on maternal record for fetal conditions

procedure_links.description: Specific procedure codes for in utero fetal surgery
procedure_links.context: Required with O35 diagnosis codes for fetal surgery
procedure_links.note: Must assign appropriate procedure code for surgery performed

warnings: Never use Chapter 16 perinatal codes on maternal record (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)
best_practices: Always assign O35 code for fetal condition requiring surgery (Evidence: pg no: 66, L85-L86)
Include appropriate procedure code for surgery performed (Evidence: pg no: 66, L86)
Code as obstetric encounter (Evidence: pg no: 66, L87)
common_mistakes: Using perinatal codes on maternal record
tips: In utero surgery always uses maternal codes, not fetal/perinatal codes
Remember to code both diagnosis and procedure
implementation_notes: Requires knowledge of appropriate procedure codes
Coordination between diagnosis and procedure coding
